( Carnage: Code, settle down! If it is THAT important to you then send me 
the posts of your characters firing towards Dinobot that I�ve obviously 
missed and I�ll make sure he gets hit? Will THAT suit you enough?!
Now, either drop it or send me the damn posts.)

   * Dinobot watched out over the battlefield, not even believing his own 
optics at what he saw.
Nothing, absolutely nothing that was part of this small clearing even 
resembled the glade Tavatron and himself had stopped in a while back.
The grass beneath their feet was churned up and now nothing but raw dirt and 
small sprigs of green poking up in the occasional place, the waterfall was 
now nothing more then a trickle emerging from crunched and fallen rock, the 
stream itself simply a drying bed of small pebbles and dirt.

I was all gone, every square inch of it.
A deep growl emanated from between his tightly clenched jaw, his hands 
balled into fists with the deadly claws of his fingers digging through each 
palm.
Yet, that only added to the pain he felt, and soon released his palms from 
the slow torture of his claws as they dug deeper and deeper with every spark 
beat.

This entire place was gone, and he couldn�t even say that it was the entire 
Alliances fault. It had also been partly his.
They shouldn�t have stopped here for such a long period of time, should have 
just collected themselves and moved on. Then, perhaps this glade would have 
been spared, and some other depth of the swamp would have looked like this 
instead.

But it was too late to try and go back in time and fix mistakes now, this, 
once wonderful, place was gone, and there was nothing that anybot could do 
now to fix it.
But, it also wasn�t entirely the glade that made Dinobot�s aggression rise, 
it was also the factor that he had forced himself to receive a defeating 
blow RIGHT at the beginning of the battle. And now he had missed the entire 
thing, without even getting so much as two shots in.
THAT was the real downer, what made him realize that maybe he should have 
hung in there just a little bit longer before suddenly getting blown out by 
a jusault.

However, he had also saved Prowls life in the process on taking that blow, 
one that could very possibly lead to his death now more then ever before.
And the feathery bastard didn�t even say, �Thank you.�
But, that really didn�t matter to him. The concern, if it was that, in which 
Prowl had expressed was good enough. For now.
But, by now Prowl had gone of to do slag knew what, leaving behind the sense 
that he would need help getting back to the Cybertronian Fire.
Well, that was what HE said anyway.
Dinobot knew that he needed help, but he didn�t want to burden anybot with 
his added weight so he wouldn�t mention it.
As long as he could stay on his feet and actually walk he would be fine, so 
he hoped anyway.

However, there was one thing in which the damaged warrior didn�t realize, 
nor notice until it was too late and nearly made his spark jump clear into 
his throat.
Looking over the smoking battlefield one last time he then turned his head 
towards his blind side, clearly to see and pinpoint just where Tavatron was.
He hadn�t seen her since he had been propelled into the trees by the force 
of Oblitercons blast, actually hoping that she would be alright.
But then as he snapped his head towards his left, he came face to face with 
exactly what he had been looking for.
And quite frankly, it startled him.

Dinobot growled at the sudden appearance of the fembot, backing up a step so 
that he could focus upon her in the process. His two dominant claws already 
fit and extended to slice through what he had thought was the enemy close 
enough to strike, then turning out to be Tavatron once his optic focused 
properly.
He relaxed slightly, but was a little unnerved that he had been surprised by 
her. Making him feel foolish and out of place his claws relaxing.
A snarl trickling from his throat. *

� Slag! WARN a bot before you come up on his blind side!!�

* That was all he managed to say before he suddenly saw the concern in 
Tavatron�s optics, making him stop and collect himself and completely forget 
any other things he was about to say�as well as a few curses.
She was worried about him and he could see that, even though she tried to 
hide it behind an emotionless expression.

But Dinobot had hid his own feelings behind such a look for years unknown, 
and he knew concern when he saw it.
She looked�she really looked worried about him.
Though his wounds caused his aggression to rise, it was slightly dampened at 
Tavatrons words.
But, he felt the pain that he had felt before, the wounds about his body far 
more then what they looked, but not all that serious as they seemed.

They were basically only flesh wounds, ones that could be easily repaired in 
less then three mega-cycles.
However, the pain of his wounds was the last thing on his mind. It was the 
concern in the fembots optics that his conciseness dwelled on now.
Dinobot nodded once, still looking at her point blank.*

� Agreed. There IS nothing left here.�

* His sight then looking off again across the clearing, his body half turned 
towards it.*

� Except�your concern.�

* He then looked back towards Tavatron, almost daring her to tell him just 
why she was so concerned about him all the time.*

� Even though it is not needed.�

* And it wasn�t.
He didn�t need her concern, and he wanted her to know that. He had far 
better things to worry about then himself at the moment, like getting her 
back to base and in one piece at the same time.
Dinobot then looked off towards the direction in which the swamp lay, where 
the quickest path to the CF and Tavatron�s safety lay.
So, with less effort then he knew, he transformed into Beast Mode. The pain 
of his wounds easing off and satisfied that the damage hadn�t been 
transferred to this mode as well. Giving his robot mode the chance to gain 
power and maybe even begin slow repairs as they traveled.

But now the pain was simply just a throb, and movement was easier now.
Dinobot turned his head towards Tavatron, waiting for her to transform as 
well so that they could get going.
It was still going to be a long, and difficult way back to base.*
